snippet: The company’s board granted Timothy Cook a one-time stock award to signal its confidence in him as the successor to Steve Jobs.
abstract: Timothy D Cook, the new chief of Apple, receives a one-time stock award worth more than $376 million, largest given by the company in a decade; award signals Apple's confidence in him as the successor to Steven P Jobs.
lead_paragraph: The company’s board granted Timothy Cook a one-time stock award to signal its confidence in him as the successor to Steve Jobs.

headline.seo: Apple’s Chief Receives Stock Worth $376 Million
headline.main: Apple Makes Stock Award for New Chief
headline.print_headline: $376 Million Stock Grant For Apple Chief
